uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player

Class DefaultMediaPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player.AbstractMediaPlayer
      • uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player.DefaultMediaPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MediaPlayer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultDirectMediaPlayer, DefaultEmbeddedMediaPlayer, DefaultHeadlessMediaPlayer

    public abstract class DefaultMediaPlayer
extends AbstractMediaPlayer
implements MediaPlayer
    Media player implementation.

        public boolean startMedia(java.lang.String mrl,
                 java.lang.String... mediaOptions)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Play a new media item, with options, and wait for it to start playing or error.

        This call will block until the media starts or errors.

        Specified by:
        startMedia in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        mrl - media resource locator
        mediaOptions - zero or more media item options
        Returns:
        true if the media started playing, false if the media failed to start because of an error

      • parseMedia

        public void parseMedia()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Parse local meta data from the current media.

        This method is synchronous.

        Parsing media may cause an HTTP request to be made to search for cover- art.

        Invoking this method on a stream or DVB channel may cause a hang.

        Specified by:
        parseMedia in interface MediaPlayer

      • requestParseMedia

        public void requestParseMedia()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Parse local meta data from the current media.

        This method is asynchronous and a media player event will be raised when the parsed status changes.

        Parsing media may cause an HTTP request to be made to search for cover- art.

        If the media has already been parsed when this function calls then no event will be raised.

        Invoking this method on a stream or DVB channel may cause a hang.

        Specified by:
        requestParseMedia in interface MediaPlayer

      • isMediaParsed

        public boolean isMediaParsed()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Test whether or not the current media has been parsed.
        Specified by:
        isMediaParsed in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        true if the current media has been parsed, otherwise false

      • getMediaMeta

        public MediaMeta getMediaMeta()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Get local meta data for the current media.

        Some media types require that the media be parsed before accessing meta data - it is the responsibility of the client application to parse the media if required, see MediaPlayer.parseMedia().

        Specified by:
        getMediaMeta in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        meta data

      • setRepeat

        public void setRepeat(boolean repeat)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Set whether or not the media player should automatically repeat playing the media when it has finished playing.

        There is no guarantee of seamless play-back when using this method - see instead MediaListPlayer.

        If the media has sub-items, then it is the sub-items that are repeated.

        Specified by:
        setRepeat in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        repeat - true to automatically replay the media, otherwise false

      • getRepeat

        public boolean getRepeat()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer

        Specified by:
        getRepeat in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        true if the media will be automatically replayed, otherwise false

      • playNextSubItem

        public boolean playNextSubItem(java.lang.String... mediaOptions)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Play the next sub-item (if there is one).

        If any standard media options have been set via MediaPlayer.setStandardMediaOptions(String...) then those options will be applied to the sub-item.

        If the media player has been set to automatically repeat, then the sub- items will be repeated once the last one has been played.

        Specified by:
        playNextSubItem in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        mediaOptions - zero or more media options for the sub-item
        Returns:
        true if there is a sub-item, otherwise false

      • playSubItem

        public boolean playSubItem(int index,
                  java.lang.String... mediaOptions)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Play a particular sub-item (if there is one).

        If any standard media options have been set via MediaPlayer.setStandardMediaOptions(String...) then those options will be applied to the sub-item.

        If the media player has been set to automatically repeat, then the sub- items will be repeated once the last one has been played, or if the requested sub-item index exceeds the currently available sub-items.

        Specified by:
        playSubItem in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        index - sub-item index
        mediaOptions - zero or more media options for the sub-item
        Returns:
        true if there is a sub-item, otherwise false

        Specified by:

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Begin play-back and wait for the media to start playing or for an error to occur.

        If called when the play-back is paused, the play-back will resume from the current position.

        This call will block until the media starts or errors.

        Specified by:
        start in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        true if the media started playing, false if the media failed to start because of an error

      • setCropGeometry

        public void setCropGeometry(java.lang.String cropGeometry)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Set the crop geometry.

        The format for the crop geometry is one of:

        • numerator:denominator
        • widthxheight+x+y
        • left:top:right:bottom
        For example: 
           mediaPlayer.setCropGeometry("4:3");         // W:H
   mediaPlayer.setCropGeometry("719x575+0+0"); // WxH+L+T
   mediaPlayer.setCropGeometry("6+10+6+10");   // L+T+R+B
        Specified by:
        setCropGeometry in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        cropGeometry - formatted string describing the desired crop geometry

      • setAudioOutput

      • getTrackInfo

        public java.util.List<TrackInfo> getTrackInfo()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Get the track (i.e. "elementary streams") information for the current media.

        The media (if local) should first be parsed, see MediaPlayer.parseMedia(), or be already playing.

        In the case of DVD media (for example ".iso" files) and streams the media must be played and video output must be available before valid track information becomes available, and even then it is not always available immediately so polling may be required.

        Specified by:
        getTrackInfo in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        collection of track information, or null if there is no current media

      • setSnapshotDirectory

        public void setSnapshotDirectory(java.lang.String snapshotDirectoryName)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Set the directory into which snapshots of the video are saved.

        If the specified directory path does not yet exist, it will be created.

        Specified by:
        setSnapshotDirectory in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:

      • saveSnapshot

        public boolean saveSnapshot()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Save a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        The size of the image will be that produced by the libvlc native snapshot function, i.e. the size of the media itself.

        The snapshot will be created in the directory set via MediaPlayer.setSnapshotDirectory(String), unless that directory has not been set in which case the snapshot will be created in the user's home directory, obtained via the "user.home" system property.

        The snapshot will be assigned a filename based on the current time.

        The size of the image will be that produced by the libvlc native snapshot function.

        Specified by:
        saveSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot was saved, otherwise false

      • saveSnapshot

        public boolean saveSnapshot(int width,
                   int height)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Save a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        The snapshot will be created in the directory set via MediaPlayer.setSnapshotDirectory(String), unless that directory has not been set in which case the snapshot will be created in the user's home directory, obtained via the "user.home" system property.

        The snapshot will be assigned a filename based on the current time.

        If one of width or height is zero the original image aspect ratio will be preserved.

        If both width and height are zero, the original image size will be used, see MediaPlayer.saveSnapshot().

        Specified by:
        saveSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        width - desired image width
        height - desired image height
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot was saved, otherwise false

      • saveSnapshot

        public boolean saveSnapshot(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Save a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        The size of the image will be that produced by the libvlc native snapshot function, i.e. the size of the media itself.

        Any missing directory path will be created if it does not exist.

        Specified by:
        saveSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        file - file to contain the snapshot
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot was saved, otherwise false

      • saveSnapshot

        public boolean saveSnapshot(java.io.File file,
                   int width,
                   int height)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Save a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        Any missing directory path will be created if it does not exist.

        If one of width or height is zero the original image aspect ratio will be preserved.

        If both width and height are zero, the original image size will be used, see MediaPlayer.saveSnapshot(File).

        Specified by:
        saveSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        file - file to contain the snapshot
        width - desired image width
        height - desired image height
        Returns:
        true if the snapshot was saved, otherwise false

      • getSnapshot

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSnapshot()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Get a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        The size of the image will be that produced by the libvlc native snapshot function, i.e. the size of the media itself.

        This implementation uses the native libvlc method to save a snapshot of the currently playing video. This snapshot is saved to a temporary file and then the resultant image is loaded from the file.

        Specified by:
        getSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        snapshot image, or null if a snapshot could not be taken

      • getSnapshot

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSnapshot(int width,
                                       int height)
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Get a snapshot of the currently playing video.

        This implementation uses the native libvlc method to save a snapshot of the currently playing video. This snapshot is saved to a temporary file and then the resultant image is loaded from the file.

        If one of width or height is zero the original image aspect ratio will be preserved.

        If both width and height are zero, the original image size will be used, see MediaPlayer.getSnapshot()

        Specified by:
        getSnapshot in interface MediaPlayer
        Parameters:
        width - desired image width
        height - desired image height
        Returns:
        snapshot image, or null if a snapshot could not be taken

      • mediaPlayerInstance

        public final libvlc_media_player_t mediaPlayerInstance()
        Description copied from interface: MediaPlayer
        Provide access to the native media player instance.

        This is exposed on the interface as an implementation side-effect, ordinary applications are not expected to use this.

        Specified by:
        mediaPlayerInstance in interface MediaPlayer
        Returns:
        media player instance

      • setVideoOutputWaitPeriod

        public void setVideoOutputWaitPeriod(int videoOutputWaitPeriod,
                            int videoOutputTimeout)
        Override the default video output test wait period.

        The native media player will be repeatedly polled according to this period in order to check if video output has started playing or not.

        This is not part of the MediaPlayer API (it an an implementation detail and so does not appear on the interface).

        Most applications will not need to use this method, instead relying on the sensible default wait period.

        Parameters:
        videoOutputWaitPeriod - wait period, in milliseconds, or zero
        videoOutputTimeout - maximum amount of time to wait for a video output to start
